subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: The Ghost Box, is training required?
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I didn't type the below quote.  I think it was embedded in the e-mail I 
was quoting from someone else.

Zack

On Thu, 9 Oct 2008, black bear hollow wrote:

> I wouldn't go so far as to say that. Not for the faint of heart? That's a bit 
> much.
>
> I have 2 of Frank's boxes. It's as simple as some are drawn to use them and 
> some aren't.
> I don't know many who bring neg. results. That can happen to even the nicest 
> people. What I can't stand
> is people tagging certain areas of research with unnecessary drama. I 
> wouldn't use the term "faint of heart"
> for certain. As for Moon's statements, if those are accurate, they are 
> illogical. Anyone can do this research, use Frank's
> boxes, or whatever and they wouldn't need his guidance.
>
> Anyone can use one of Frank's boxes. Results vary. No drama. Many things can 
> happen with this
> research, but outlandish results are rare and can easily be dealt with.
>
> w
>
>
> On Oct 9, 2008, at 9:56 AM, Zack Widup wrote:
>
>> I could agree that box research
>>> isn't meant for everyone nor is it everyone's cup of tea. Reckless use
>>> can bring negative results and that is a very real possibility, so
>>> definately not for the faint of heart.
>
